lines.line_text: generous muse, assistance lend;
Ye simple village-swains attend;
I mean not to complain:
I'll tell you what the youth must be,
That hopes to gain the love of me,
And be my Fav'rite Swain.
I ne'er can love the silly swain,
That quits the village and the plain,
To flutter round the state;
Nor fool that leaves the woodbine bower,
To fix on that uncertain flower,
The favour of the great:

stanzas.stanza_text:
I ne'er can love the silly swain,
That quits the village and the plain,
To flutter round the state;
Nor fool that leaves the woodbine bower,
To fix on that uncertain flower,
The favour of the great:

lines.line_text: But I some artless youth must find,
That knows not how to veil his mind,
But speaks without disguise;
His count'nance cheering as the dawn,
That smiles upon the flowery lawn,
And bids the sky-lark rise:

stanzas.stanza_text:
But I some artless youth must find,
That knows not how to veil his mind,
But speaks without disguise;
His count'nance cheering as the dawn,
That smiles upon the flowery lawn,
And bids the sky-lark rise:

lines.line_text: His eyes like dew-drops on the thorn,
When daisies opening to the morn,
Bespeak that morning fair;
His breath as sweet as western breeze,
That sweeps the sweetest smelling trees,
To scent the evening air.

stanzas.stanza_text:
His eyes like dew-drops on the thorn,
When daisies opening to the morn,
Bespeak that morning fair;
His breath as sweet as western breeze,
That sweeps the sweetest smelling trees,
To scent the evening air.

lines.line_text: And when he pipes upon the plain,
He must all approbation gain,
In spite of envious pride;
And force his rival swains to say,
His matchless skill must bear the sway,
It cannot be denied.

stanzas.stanza_text:
And when he pipes upon the plain,
He must all approbation gain,
In spite of envious pride;
And force his rival swains to say,
His matchless skill must bear the sway,
It cannot be denied.

lines.line_text: No passions like the northern wind,
Must discompose his steady mind,
By seriousness possest;
Yet sadness be as far away,
As darkest midnight from noon-day,
Or point of east from west.

stanzas.stanza_text:
No passions like the northern wind,
Must discompose his steady mind,
By seriousness possest;
Yet sadness be as far away,
As darkest midnight from noon-day,
Or point of east from west.

lines.line_text: His temper mild as April rain,
Whose gentle shower bedews the plain,
And gems the budding spray;
In manners like the lowly rill,
That creeps beneath the grassy hill,
Where shining fishes play.

stanzas.stanza_text:
His temper mild as April rain,
Whose gentle shower bedews the plain,
And gems the budding spray;
In manners like the lowly rill,
That creeps beneath the grassy hill,
Where shining fishes play.

lines.line_text: No headstrong passion must incline
Him to my arms, or make him mine,
But reason must approve;
To nicest honour be consign'd,
While virtue rules his generous mind,
And friendship crowns his love.

stanzas.stanza_text:
No headstrong passion must incline
Him to my arms, or make him mine,
But reason must approve;
To nicest honour be consign'd,
While virtue rules his generous mind,
And friendship crowns his love.

lines.line_text: Methinks the envious youths around,
Say such a one was never found,
And all my search is vain:
Mistaken swains know this my song,
Does to my Thirsis all belong,
For he's my Fav'rite Swain.

stanzas.stanza_text:
Methinks the envious youths around,
Say such a one was never found,
And all my search is vain:
Mistaken swains know this my song,
Does to my Thirsis all belong,
For he's my Fav'rite Swain.
